text: Tomb Princes are the sons of the Tomb Kings. Each of the kings of ancient Nehekhara had many heirs, but only one could succeed his father to the throne.
In the shadows of the great pyramids do the Liche Priests practice their dark arts. While some excel in Death Magic, or even Light, others have tamed Phantasmancy.
The Lore of Nehekhara was created by the Liche Priests of the Mortuary Cult in their quest to unlock the secrets of immortality.
Where there is dark there must be light. And so, just as day follows night, there are those in the Mortuary Cult who are skilled at banishment magic, and white wizardry.
It is no surprise that some Liche Priests excel at manipulating the Wind of Shyish, and are unsurpassed at Death Magic.
A select few of the Liche Priests now loyal to Nagash were given the honour of handling the Great Necromancer's own spells of his own device.
Wight Kings are incredibly powerful Undead, almost as hard to destroy as Vampires. Suffused with Dark Magic, their weapons shimmer with baleful energy.
Masters of the ballistic arts, even in death Gunnery Wights maintain the lines and a steady flow of black powder.
The most powerful Hammurai of Ptra are turned into willing emissaries of Nagash, spearheads of doom.
A single Banshee is a terrifying prospect, and even those warriors skilled enough to match blades with a Vampire have little defence against her unnatural screams.
The Right Hand of Luthor Harkon
The right hand of Luthor Harkon, which is somewhat ironic, since he lost his own left hand following the Vampire Admiral into battle.
